name: Awesome Sweet Potato Casserole
author: Teri Head
summary: This recipe was given to me in the late 1980s by Diane Thornton in Jackson Mississippi.  I have made it each year since, and when I bring it to gatherings people rave about it, so I bring it year after year.  Some people say it's more like a desert than a side dish. All I know is that it's a standby for me and always gets a nod.
ingredients: ½ (14 ounce) bag flaked coconut, or more to taste
directions: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Beat the pineapple, coconut, sweet potatoes, white sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, milk, and 1/2 cup melted butter together in a large mixing bowl until smooth
Pour mixture into the prepared pan; set aside
Mix the flour, brown sugar, 1/3 cup butter, and pecans in a bowl
Sprinkle pecan mixture over the batter
Bake in the preheated oven until the casserole is bubbly and the topping is browned, about 30 minutes
